task.title: Creating Your Proposal Template
task.shortdesc: a step-by-step guide to moving RFP content into a workable Word response

context.p: Breaking down your RFP will help you form your response. Always follow RFP explicit structure rules first, and default to RFP internal structure when no rule applies.

steps.stepsection: To break down your RFP or RFI:

step.cmd: Identify and save all evaluation criteria
step.stepresult: Once done, you have all the pieces needed to create a compliant, responsive proposal response skeleton.

step.cmd: Create a cover page and include all information requested in the RFP submittal requirements

substep.cmd: Typical information includes: Title, RFP Number, Government Contact, Vendor Contact

step.cmd: Using the format of the original RFP, paste in any and all requirements to which the vendor will respond.
Using the styling and formatting requirements, create a style guide in Word to keep your document consistent.

substep.cmd: You can also use their formatting rules and the text of their RFP to begin creating your Wall of Truth. Please refer to the Wall of Truth page for more information on how to use this tool.
substep.stepresult: By mimicking the style of the RFP itself, the vendor is more likely to complete a compliant proposal. A rule of thumb in proposal management is "give them back their own words." That is, when in doubt, use the wording or style of the RFP in your response.

step.cmd: Identify sections of the RFP and assign them to your team members for content input
